member.summary: Gets the list of products identifiers sorted in alphabetical order which are bigger than and have been modified after but before . This method can return all products matching the requested filter or return only the first batch of items, because this method is invoked again and again by advancing the until an empty collection is returned.
member.param: An identifier of the product to start looking from.
The date after which products should be checked.
The date before which products should be checked.
member.returns: The list of product identifiers.

member.summary: The payment status indicating that the payment has been successfully completed.

member.summary: The payment status indicating that the payment process or the corresponding payment transaction has been cancelled either by the user or by the payment gateway.

member.name: F:Sana.Extensions.Payment.PaymentStatus.Error
member.summary: The payment status indicating that there is an error on processing payment transaction and status can't be determined. In this case user should not be allowed to pay again and shop administrator should investigate this situation by themselves and resolve payment status manually. In case an error occurs before user has been redirected to payment page or there is an error in configuration which doesn't allow to pay order in-place, the status should be used instead. In case there was an error with payment (e.g. from card number is used) so that the extension can be sure that customer account hasn't being charged, the status should be used instead.

member.name: P:Sana.Extensions.SanaApi.SecureInMemoryStorage
member.summary: Gets the instance of secure in memory storage for current extension.

remarks.para: This is a temporary storage that can be used to hold sensitive data in memory between requests, e.g. you can save payment card's data here and it will be available to you in subsequent requests as if it was stored in server's session. The data is stored only in memory, it is not saved to any physical storage like database or file and is not transmitted via network or the internet to other servers. The data is stored in encrypted form. This makes it compliant with PCI DSS requirements and can be qualified as cardholder's data processing (not storage or transmission). You can control stored data's lifetime by configuring its expiration and explicitly removing it when it is not needed.

Use this storage only if it is really needed. It does not guarantee 100% data protection against malicious user, it just gives a possibility to be PCI DSS compliant when you need to keep some sensitive data in between requests. Such data cannot be stored in SQL database and cannot be kept in session state hence this solution.

example.para:
Retrieving previously saved CVV code on some subsequent checkout step.
string cvv = Api.SecureInMemoryStorage.Retrieve("cvv");

According to PCI DSS you must explicitly remove cardholder's sensitive data after successful authorization.
Api.SecureInMemoryStorage.Forget("cvv");
